wms_article.title: Korea East-West Power to establish AI transformation strategies

wms_article_body.body: 유빈2b Korea East-West Power to establish AI transformation strategies By Cho Sung-shin and Han Yubin The Korea East-West Power (EWP) Co., a state-run utility firm, has launched an initiative to weave artificial intelligence (AI) into every corner of its operations. The company held a strategy meeting at its headquarters in Ulsan on Monday, kicking off a multi-year innovation program. The initiative, described as a shift for the power industry, will embed AI in both decision-making and day-to-day processes. The company will partner with the U Institute for Future Strategy, a think tank at Ulsan National Institute of Science and Technology (UNIST), to design an AI roadmap tailored to the unique demands of the power sector and the operating realities of public corporations. Planned applications span optimizing power plant operations, predicting and diagnosing equipment issues, automating management decisions, and upgrading customer service. A dedicated task force - drawn from the company’s organization, human resources, power generation, and tech divisions - will lead the effort.
